intro: Flaveria latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf flaveria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Flaveria latifolia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments.
